Package com.algonquincollege.cst8284.assignment3

Class CharacterRecord

java.lang.Object
com.algonquincollege.cst8284.assignment3.CharacterRecord
public class CharacterRecord
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains the data for a CharacterRecord. The fields have basic data validation in each of the mutator methods (setters).

- Every set method validates the data passed into it. - throws an IllegalArgumentException with a message containing the field name, and reason for the exception being thrown. - None of the String fields should be set with text containing a comma character e.g. ',' - The field named "name" cannot exceed 50 characters in length. (The other String fields do not have any limits to length.) - attackChance1, and attackChance2 cannot be negative, cannot exceed 100. Note: The sum of attackChance1 and attackChance2 can exceed 100, but each separate field cannot.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private int attackChance1
    contains the percent chance for attack1 to be generated
    private int attackChance2
    contains the percent chance for attack2 to be generated
    private java.lang.String attackDamage
    contains a description of how attack damage is calculated
    private java.lang.String attackType1
    contains the name of the type of attack1
    private java.lang.String attackType2
    contains the name of the type of attack2
    private java.lang.String defense
    contains a description of how this character defends from attack
    private java.lang.String health
    contains a description of how health is calculated
    private java.lang.String name
    contains the name of the character
    private java.lang.String strength
    contains a description of how strength is calculated

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Provides a comma-separated-value String representation. There is no formatting of fields, and there is no ending line terminator. The order of the fields returned is: name,health,strength,attackDamage,attackChance1,attackChance2, attackType1,attackType2,defense return a comma-separated-value String representation.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
